title: ai-ensembles
text:
1 AI Ensembles Visualizations
Welcome to the AI Ensembles visualization documentation. This book contains the processed results and visualizations from our AI notebooks.

title: ai-ensembles
text:
1.2 About
This documentation is generated automatically from AI notebook processing results. Each chapter contains: - Original documentation content - AI processing results - Generated visualizations - Analysis summaries

title: 2  AI Ensembles
text:
3 AI Ensembles Overview
AI Ensembles are collections of AI-powered notebooks that work together to process and analyze documents, audio, and other data sources. This chapter introduces the core concepts and architecture of AI ensembles.

title: 2  AI Ensembles
text:
3.1 Core Concepts
An AI ensemble consists of:

AI Notebooks

Collection of .qmd files
Each notebook has a specific purpose
Notebooks can reference each other’s results

Processing Pipeline

Document parsing
AI model processing
Result generation
Visualization creation

title: 2  AI Ensembles
text:
3.2 Directory Structure
ai-ensembles/
├── notebooks/           # AI notebook collection
│   ├── 01-analysis.qmd
│   └── 02-results.qmd
├── process/            # Processing results
│   ├── analysis.json
│   └── results.json
├── ai-views/           # Generated visualizations
│   └── analysis-vis.qmd
├── sources/           # Shared resources
│   └── templates/
│       └── document.j2
└── settings.json      # Configuration

title: 2  AI Ensembles
2  AI Ensembles
text:
3.4 AI Block Structure
AI blocks in notebooks use this format:
::: {.callout-note collapse="true"}
### Input

*Model: gemini-2, Label: analysis_1*

**Instruction:**
Your prompt here...

**Template:**
```yaml
[
  {
    "file": "sources/templates/document.j2",
    "variables": {
      "KEY": "value"
    }
  }
]
:::






Response (7.4s)





Instructions to prepend…
TEMPLATE: Analyze the following text:
Provide analysis focusing on: 1. Main themes 2. Key arguments 3. Supporting evidence
INSTRUCTION: Analyze the following text:
“The rapid advancement of artificial intelligence (AI) presents both unprecedented opportunities and significant challenges for society. On the one hand, AI has the potential to revolutionize various sectors, from healthcare and education to transportation and manufacturing. For example, AI-powered diagnostic tools could lead to earlier detection and more effective treatment of diseases, while automated vehicles could dramatically reduce traffic accidents. Furthermore, AI-driven systems can optimize resource allocation, enhance productivity, and accelerate scientific discovery. However, the widespread adoption of AI also raises concerns about job displacement, algorithmic bias, and ethical dilemmas. As AI systems become increasingly sophisticated, they may surpass human capabilities in certain domains, leading to unemployment in specific sectors. Moreover, if AI algorithms are trained on biased data, they may perpetuate and even amplify existing societal inequalities. Finally, the lack of transparency in some AI decision-making processes raises questions about accountability and fairness. It is imperative that we proactively address these challenges through careful planning, regulation, and ethical considerations to ensure that AI benefits all of humanity.”




## Cross-Notebook References

Notebooks can reference results from other notebooks:

```markdown

::: {.callout-note collapse="true"}
### Input

*Model: gemini-2*

**Instruction:**
Compare these analyses:
1. Previous findings: [Error: Label initial_analysis not found in 01-analysis]
2. New results: [Error: Label detailed_review not found in 02-results]
:::

::: {.callout-tip collapse="true"}
### Response (3.7s)

Okay, I understand the instruction. However, the provided analyses are missing. The placeholders indicate:

1. **Previous findings:**  There should be a section labelled `initial_analysis` in a document named `01-analysis`, but it's not present.
2. **New results:** There should be a section labelled `detailed_review` in a document named `02-results`, but it's also missing.

**I cannot perform the comparison without the content of these sections.**

**To proceed, you need to provide me with the content that is supposed to be in those sections. For example, you would need to provide me with text like this:**

01-analysis (with “initial_analysis” section):

title: 2  AI Ensembles
text:
5.1 Processing Flow

Document Loading
ainotebook load notebooks/01-analysis.qmd
AI Processing
ainotebook process notebooks/*.qmd
Visualization
ainotebook visualize notebooks/01-analysis.qmd

title: 2  AI Ensembles
text:
5.2 Best Practices

Notebook Organization

Use numbered prefixes (01-, 02-, etc.)
One main task per notebook
Clear dependencies between notebooks

Template Management

Store shared templates in sources/templates
Use consistent variable names
Document template requirements

Error Handling

Validate inputs before processing
Check for missing dependencies
Log processing errors

title: 3  AI Notebooks
text:
4 AI Notebooks
AI Notebooks are Quarto documents (.qmd) that combine regular markdown content with special AI processing blocks. This chapter explains their structure and usage.

title: 3  AI Notebooks
text:
4.1 Supported Models

4.1.1 Anthropic Models

Gemini 2 (gemini-2)

Fast responses
Cost-effective
Best for: Quick analyses, drafts, iterations

Claude 3 Sonnet (claude-3-5-sonnet)

Balanced performance
Advanced reasoning
200K context
Best for: Complex analysis, academic writing




4.1.2 Google Models

Gemini Pro

General purpose
Code generation
32K context
Best for: Technical documentation, code analysis

Gemini 2.0 Flash Thinking (gemini-2.0-flash-thinking-exp-01-21)

Experimental model
Fast responses
Best for: Quick iterations and experiments




4.1.3 Groq Models

Mixtral 8x7B (mixtral-8x7b-32768)

32K context window
High performance
Best for: Long-form analysis

LLaMA2 70B (llama2-70b-4096)

4K context window
General purpose
Best for: Standard text processing




4.1.4 Other Models

O3-Mini

Lightweight model
Fast processing
Best for: Simple tasks and testing




4.1.5 Audio Processing Models

Whisper Large v3

Multiple languages
Robust transcription
Speaker diarization
Best for: Lecture transcription, interviews

title: 3  AI Notebooks
text:
4.2 Basic Structure
An AI notebook consists of:

YAML Header
Regular Markdown Content
AI Processing Blocks
Generated Results


4.2.1 Example: Document Analysis
---
title: "Document Analysis"
author: "Researcher Name"
date: last-modified
---

# Analysis Overview



### Example: Audio Processing


## AI Block Components

### 1. Model Selection

```yaml
# Text Analysis
model: gemini-2                           # Fast, efficient
model: claude-3-5-sonnet                          # Balanced performance
model: gemini-pro                                 # General purpose
model: gemini-2-thinking                         # Experimental Flash Thinking
model: mixtral-8x7b-32768                        # High performance
model: llama2-70b-4096                           # General purpose
model: o3-mini                                   # Lightweight

# Audio Processing
model: whisper-large-v3                          # High accuracy transcription


4.2.2 2. Processing Options
# Basic options
overwrite: false         # Skip if results exist
label: analysis_1        # Reference label
preamble: "text"         # Prepend to prompt

# Template usage
template:
  - file: analysis.j2    # Template file
    variables:           # Template variables
      TEXT: input.txt
      STYLE: academic

# Model-specific options
options:
  temperature: 0.1       # Response creativity
  max_tokens: 8192       # Maximum response length
  language: "en"         # Content language


4.2.3 3. File Assignments
files:
  document: sources/text.txt     # Load file content
  context: sources/context.txt   # Additional context
  audio: sources/lecture.mp3     # Audio file

title: 3  AI Notebooks
text:
4.3 Template System
Templates support multiple formats and use cases:

4.3.1 1. Academic Analysis Template
{# academic_analysis.j2 #}
Analyze the following text in {{STYLE}} style:

Text to analyze:
{{TEXT}}

Provide analysis focusing on:
1. Main themes
2. Key arguments
3. Supporting evidence


4.3.2 2. Data Extraction Template
{# data_extract.j2 #}
Extract structured information from this text:
{{TEXT}}

Required fields:
- dates: List all dates in ISO format
- names: Extract person names
- locations: Identify place names
- events: List key events

Output format: JSON

title: 3  AI Notebooks
text:
4.4 Advanced Features

4.4.1 1. Chain Processing
chain:
  - model: gemini-2
    label: metadata
  - template: analyze.j2
    variables:
      CONTEXT: "{{metadata}}"
  - template: summarize.j2


4.4.2 2. Parallel Processing
parallel:
  - label: text_analysis
    model: gemini-2
  - label: code_review
    model: gemini-pro
  - label: transcription
    model: whisper-large-v3


4.4.3 3. Conditional Processing
conditions:
  - if: "{{word_count}} > 1000"
    use: summarize.j2
  - else:
    use: direct_analysis.j2

title: 3  AI Notebooks
3  AI Notebooks
text:
4.6 Cross-References

4.6.1 1. Within Same Notebook
---
model: gemini-pro
---
Review this analysis: {{analysis_1}}


4.6.2 2. Across Notebooks
---
model: gemini-2
---
Compare:
1. {{01-extract:metadata}}
2. {{02-analyze:findings}}

title: 3  AI Notebooks
text:
4.7 Error Handling

Missing Files

files:
  required: true           # Fail if missing
  document: input.txt     
  fallback: default.txt   # Use if primary missing

Processing Errors

---
title: "AI Notebooks"
author: "Gerd Graßhoff"
date: last-modified
---

# AI Notebooks

AI Notebooks are Quarto documents (.qmd) that combine regular markdown content with special AI processing blocks. This chapter explains their structure and usage.

## Supported Models

### Anthropic Models

- Gemini 2 (gemini-2)
  - Fast responses
  - Cost-effective
  - Best for: Quick analyses, drafts, iterations

- Claude 3 Sonnet (claude-3-5-sonnet)
  - Balanced performance
  - Advanced reasoning
  - 200K context
  - Best for: Complex analysis, academic writing

### Google Models

- Gemini Pro
  - General purpose
  - Code generation
  - 32K context
  - Best for: Technical documentation, code analysis

- Gemini 2.0 Flash Thinking (gemini-2.0-flash-thinking-exp-01-21)
  - Experimental model
  - Fast responses
  - Best for: Quick iterations and experiments

### Groq Models

- Mixtral 8x7B (mixtral-8x7b-32768)
  - 32K context window
  - High performance
  - Best for: Long-form analysis

- LLaMA2 70B (llama2-70b-4096)
  - 4K context window
  - General purpose
  - Best for: Standard text processing

### Other Models

- O3-Mini
  - Lightweight model
  - Fast processing
  - Best for: Simple tasks and testing

### Audio Processing Models

- Whisper Large v3
  - Multiple languages
  - Robust transcription
  - Speaker diarization
  - Best for: Lecture transcription, interviews

## Basic Structure

An AI notebook consists of:

1. YAML Header
2. Regular Markdown Content
3. AI Processing Blocks
4. Generated Results

### Example: Document Analysis

```markdown
---
title: "Document Analysis"
author: "Researcher Name"
date: last-modified
---

# Analysis Overview



### Example: Audio Processing


## AI Block Components

### 1. Model Selection

```yaml
# Text Analysis
model: gemini-2                           # Fast, efficient
model: claude-3-5-sonnet                          # Balanced performance
model: gemini-pro                                 # General purpose
model: gemini-2-thinking                         # Experimental Flash Thinking
model: mixtral-8x7b-32768                        # High performance
model: llama2-70b-4096                           # General purpose
model: o3-mini                                   # Lightweight

# Audio Processing
model: whisper-large-v3                          # High accuracy transcription

4.7.1 2. Processing Options
# Basic options
overwrite: false         # Skip if results exist
label: analysis_1        # Reference label
preamble: "text"         # Prepend to prompt

# Template usage
template:
  - file: analysis.j2    # Template file
    variables:           # Template variables
      TEXT: input.txt
      STYLE: academic

# Model-specific options
options:
  temperature: 0.1       # Response creativity
  max_tokens: 8192       # Maximum response length
  language: "en"         # Content language


4.7.2 3. File Assignments
files:
  document: sources/text.txt     # Load file content
  context: sources/context.txt   # Additional context
  audio: sources/lecture.mp3     # Audio file

title: 3  AI Notebooks
text:
4.8 Template System
Templates support multiple formats and use cases:

4.8.1 1. Academic Analysis Template
{# academic_analysis.j2 #}
Analyze the following text in {{STYLE}} style:

Text to analyze:
{{TEXT}}

Provide analysis focusing on:
1. Main themes
2. Key arguments
3. Supporting evidence


4.8.2 2. Data Extraction Template
{# data_extract.j2 #}
Extract structured information from this text:
{{TEXT}}

Required fields:
- dates: List all dates in ISO format
- names: Extract person names
- locations: Identify place names
- events: List key events

Output format: JSON

title: 3  AI Notebooks
text:
4.9 Advanced Features

4.9.1 1. Chain Processing
chain:
  - model: gemini-2
    label: metadata
  - template: analyze.j2
    variables:
      CONTEXT: "{{metadata}}"
  - template: summarize.j2


4.9.2 2. Parallel Processing
parallel:
  - label: text_analysis
    model: gemini-2
  - label: code_review
    model: gemini-pro
  - label: transcription
    model: whisper-large-v3


4.9.3 3. Conditional Processing
conditions:
  - if: "{{word_count}} > 1000"
    use: summarize.j2
  - else:
    use: direct_analysis.j2

title: 3  AI Notebooks
3  AI Notebooks
text:
4.11 Cross-References

4.11.1 1. Within Same Notebook
---
model: gemini-pro
---
Review this analysis: {{analysis_1}}


4.11.2 2. Across Notebooks
---
model: gemini-2
---
Compare:
1. {{01-extract:metadata}}
2. {{02-analyze:findings}}

title: 3  AI Notebooks
text:
4.12 Error Handling

Missing Files

files:
  required: true           # Fail if missing
  document: input.txt     
  fallback: default.txt   # Use if primary missing

Processing Errors


:::

title: 4  AI Tasks
text:
5 AI Tasks
AI tasks are the core processing units within AI notebooks. This chapter covers the different types of tasks, their configuration, and best practices for implementation.

title: 4  AI Tasks
text:
5.1 Task Types

5.1.1 1. Text Analysis
---
model: gemini-2
task: analysis
label: historical_analysis
---
Analyze this historical document focusing on:
1. Key events and dates
2. Historical figures
3. Social context


5.1.2 2. Audio Processing
---
model: whisper-large-v3
task: transcription
options:
  language: "de"
  diarization: true
---
Transcribe this lecture recording with speaker identification


5.1.3 3. Data Extraction
---
model: gemini-pro
task: extraction
format: json
---
Extract structured data from this text:
- Dates (ISO format)
- Person names
- Organizations
- Locations

title: 4  AI Tasks
text:
5.2 Task Configuration

5.2.1 1. Basic Settings
task:
  type: analysis          # Task type
  format: markdown        # Output format
  language: "en"         # Content language
  timeout: 300           # Seconds


5.2.2 2. Model Selection
# Fast Processing
model: gemini-2
options:
  temperature: 0.1
  max_tokens: 4096

# High Accuracy
model: claude-3-5-sonnet
options:
  temperature: 0.2
  max_tokens: 8192

# Experimental
model: gemini-2-thinking
options:
  temperature: 0.5
  max_tokens: 4096


5.2.3 3. Processing Chains
chain:
  - task: extract_metadata
    model: gemini-2
    label: metadata
    
  - task: analyze_content
    model: claude-3-5-sonnet
    variables:
      CONTEXT: "{{metadata}}"
    
  - task: summarize
    model: gemini-2
    template: summary.j2

title: 4  AI Tasks
4  AI Tasks
text:
5.4 Task Processing

5.4.1 1. Sequential Processing
sequence:
  - task: preprocess
    model: o3-mini
    
  - task: main_analysis
    model: claude-3-5-sonnet
    
  - task: summarize
    model: gemini-2


5.4.2 2. Parallel Processing
parallel:
  - task: text_analysis
    model: gemini-2
    
  - task: metadata
    model: mixtral-8x7b-32768
    
  - task: transcription
    model: whisper-large-v3

title: 4  AI Tasks
text:
5.5 Error Handling

5.5.1 1. Retry Configuration
retry:
  max_attempts: 3
  delay: 1000
  backoff: exponential
  conditions:
    - error_type: timeout
    - error_type: rate_limit


5.5.2 2. Fallback Models
models:
  primary: claude-3-5-sonnet
  fallback:
    - gemini-2
    - gemini-pro
    - o3-mini

title: 4  AI Tasks
text:
5.6 Best Practices

Task Design

One primary objective per task
Clear input/output specifications
Appropriate model selection

Performance Optimization

Use fast models for simple tasks
Parallel processing when possible
Efficient chain design

Error Management

Comprehensive retry logic
Graceful fallback options
Clear error reporting

Resource Usage

Monitor token consumption
Balance speed vs accuracy
Optimize context length

title: 5  Data Structure
text:
6 Data Structure
This chapter explains how data is organized in AI ensembles, including source files, templates, and processing results.

title: 5  Data Structure
text:
6.1 Directory Structure
ai-ensembles/
├── notebooks/           # AI notebook collection
├── sources/            # Source files and templates
│   ├── templates/      # Jinja2 templates
│   ├── documents/      # Input documents
│   ├── audio/         # Audio files
│   └── instructions/   # Task instructions
├── process/           # Processing results
├── ai-views/          # Generated visualizations
└── docs/             # Generated documentation

title: 5  Data Structure
text:
6.2 Source Files

6.2.1 1. Templates Directory
Templates are stored in sources/templates/ and follow Jinja2 syntax:
{# sources/templates/document.j2 #}
Analyze the following text in {{STYLE}} style:

Text to analyze:
{{TEXT}}

Required analysis:
1. {{#each REQUIREMENTS}}
   - {{this}}
   {{/each}}


6.2.2 2. Document Sources
Text documents in sources/documents/ can be referenced in notebooks:
files:
  input: documents/manuscript.txt
  context: documents/background.md
  metadata: documents/metadata.json


6.2.3 3. Audio Sources
Audio files in sources/audio/ support various formats:
files:
  recording: audio/lecture.mp3
  interview: audio/interview.wav
  meeting: audio/meeting.m4a

title: 5  Data Structure
5  Data Structure
text:
6.4 AI Views
Generated visualizations in ai-views/:

6.4.1 1. View Structure
ai-views/
├── _quarto.yml              # Quarto configuration
├── index.qmd                # Main page
├── analysis-vis.qmd         # Analysis visualization
└── results-vis.qmd          # Results visualization


6.4.2 2. View Configuration
# ai-views/_quarto.yml
project:
  type: book
  output-dir: ../docs

book:
  title: "AI Ensemble Results"
  chapters:
    - index.qmd
    - analysis-vis.qmd
    - results-vis.qmd

format:
  html:
    theme: sandstone
    code-fold: true

title: 5  Data Structure
text:
6.5 File Naming Conventions

Notebooks
NN-purpose.qmd          # e.g., 01-analysis.qmd
Templates
purpose_type.j2         # e.g., analysis_academic.j2
Source Files
YYYY-MM-DD_name.ext     # e.g., 2024-02-15_manuscript.txt
Results
notebook_id_block_id.json  # e.g., 01-analysis_block1.json

title: 5  Data Structure
text:
6.6 Best Practices

Source Organization

Use clear directory structure
Follow naming conventions
Include metadata files

Template Management

Group related templates
Document variables
Version control templates

Result Storage

Organize by notebook
Include processing metadata
Regular cleanup of cache

File Access

Use relative paths
Check file existence
Handle missing files gracefully

title: 6  CLI Execution
text:
7 CLI Execution
This chapter covers the command-line tools ainotebook and aiaudio for processing AI notebooks and audio files.

title: 6  CLI Execution
text:
7.1 AINotebook CLI
The ainotebook command processes AI notebooks and manages visualizations.

7.1.1 Basic Commands
# Process a single notebook
ainotebook process notebooks/01-analysis.qmd

# Process multiple notebooks
ainotebook process notebooks/*.qmd

# Generate visualizations
ainotebook visualize notebooks/01-analysis.qmd


7.1.2 Command Options
ainotebook [command] [options] <files>

Commands:
  process    Process AI blocks in notebooks
  visualize  Generate visualization notebooks
  clean      Clean process directory
  info       Show notebook information

Options:
  --overwrite       Force reprocessing of blocks
  --model <name>    Override default model
  --parallel        Enable parallel processing
  --verbose        Show detailed output


7.1.3 Processing Examples

Basic Processing

# Process with default settings
ainotebook process notebooks/01-analysis.qmd

# Force reprocessing
ainotebook process --overwrite notebooks/01-analysis.qmd

# Use specific model
ainotebook process --model claude-3-5-haiku notebooks/*.qmd

Batch Processing

# Process all notebooks
ainotebook process notebooks/

# Process with pattern
ainotebook process "notebooks/*-analysis.qmd"

# Parallel processing
ainotebook process --parallel notebooks/*.qmd

title: 6  CLI Execution
text:
7.2 AIAudio CLI
The aiaudio command handles audio file processing and transcription.

7.2.1 Basic Usage
# Transcribe audio file
aiaudio transcribe sources/audio/lecture.mp3

# Process with speaker detection
aiaudio transcribe --speakers sources/audio/interview.mp3

# Batch processing
aiaudio transcribe sources/audio/*.mp3


7.2.2 Command Options
aiaudio [command] [options] <files>

Commands:
  transcribe  Transcribe audio files
  diarize     Detect and label speakers
  clean       Remove temporary files

Options:
  --language <code>   Source language
  --speakers         Enable speaker detection
  --format <type>    Output format (txt/json)
  --timestamps      Include timestamps

title: 6  CLI Execution
6  CLI Execution
text:
7.4 Error Handling

7.4.1 Common Issues

Authentication Errors

# Check API keys
ainotebook check-auth

# Test specific provider
ainotebook check-auth --provider anthropic

Processing Errors

# Show detailed error information
ainotebook process --verbose notebooks/01-analysis.qmd

# Retry failed blocks
ainotebook retry notebooks/01-analysis.qmd


7.4.2 Logging
# Enable debug logging
ainotebook --debug process notebooks/*.qmd

# Save logs to file
ainotebook --log process.log process notebooks/*.qmd

title: 6  CLI Execution
text:
7.5 Best Practices

CLI Usage

Use appropriate commands for tasks
Check command options
Monitor processing status

Error Management

Check authentication before processing
Use verbose mode for debugging
Keep logs for troubleshooting

Performance

Enable parallel processing when appropriate
Use caching for repeated operations
Clean cache periodically

Security

Secure API keys
Use environment variables
Validate input files
